results.title: 'M' [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Seymour Nebenzal and Nero-Film
results.brief_description: Peter Lorre in his greatest role portrays a psychotic child molester - a pathetic vagabond figure who experiences a frenzy at the sight of tender young school girls, and try as he may, he is unable to control the fervour of his criminal inclinations. The police disregard his letters of confession to them as the work of a lunatic, leaving the underworld to take the law into their own hands. The stylised realism of the sets and the detachment with which the opposing forces of law and outlawry are portrayed place this now classic film within the ambit of the so-called ‘new objectivity’ which was a reaction in Germany to the expressionist movement. This version is the longest available.

results.title: Gidget goes to Rome
results.creator_credit: Paul Wendkos, Jerry Bresler and Jerry Bresler Productions
results.brief_description: Gidget Goes to Rome is the third film to be made inspired by the sun-happy and beach-loving characters created by Frederick Kohner in the mid 50s. In this film, Francie “Gidget” Lawrence goes to Italy with her boyfriend, Moondoggie, and their friends for a whirlwind tour of Rome. Although chaperoned by Aunt Albertina, the two aren’t stopped from experiencing brief extracurricular flirtations. Cast includes: Cindy Carol, James Darren, Jesse Royce Landis, Cesare Danova, Danielle de Metz and Joby Baker.

results.title: Regarding Henry
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Scott Rudin and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Harrison Ford stars as Henry Turner, a successful but ruthless New York lawyer who must win at any cost, even at the expense of his family. A single, freakish gunshot brings Henry’s world crashing down as he is left incapacitated and with no memory of the life he used to lead. Now, faced with starting over, Henry will learn the painful truth about his life and rediscover the family he never really had. Also starring Annette Bening as Henry’s long-suffering wife, this thought provoking film questions the importance of money over family and ultimately - the price of happiness.

results.title: Drunken Master
results.creator_credit: Yuen Woo-Ping, Zhang Quan and Seasonal Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Yuen Woo-Ping, Zhang Quan and Seasonal Film Corporation
results.description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master. Wong Fei Hung, played by Chan, is a 19th Century folk hero in Chinese culture and cinema, a master of kung fu who fights the injustice of British colonialism (this character would later be portrayed by Jet Li in ‘Once upon a time in China’). Drunken Master finds Wong in his early years as a troublesome fighter who is sent to his uncle, the hard-drinking title character, for instruction in discipline and martial arts. After enduring torturous training, Wong runs away only to encounter some local villains. Being badly beaten, he returns to his uncle who finally trains him in “drunken style” kung fu. Cast includes: Jackie Chan, Simon Yuen and Lam Yin.

results.title: Election
results.creator_credit: Alexander Payne, Albert Berger, David Gale, Keith Samples, Ron Yerxa, Bona Fide Productions, MTV Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Matthew Broderick plays Jim McAllister, a popular and well respected teacher at George Washington Carver High School. Reese Witherspoon is Tracy Flick, A-Grade student and No. 1 candidate for the student body president. Tracy is confident that her campaign for presidency is going smoothly until Mr McAllister decides to disrupt proceedings and introduce opposition to her as yet unchallenged ride to the top. More than a teenage flick, director Alexander Payne has satirized the popular genre to investigate notions of political and moral corruption. In a clever piece of casting, Matthew Broderick exchanges his Ferris Bueller persona for the devoted and concerned teacher who is slightly burned out from years of teaching. Add to this the disillusionment of a dull marriage and the shameful dismissal of McAllister’s best friend and colleague, and the esteemed civic teacher’s sense of democracy is put to the test. Brilliant performances, subtle humour and an excellent screenplay (an Oscar nomination for Payne and co-writer Jim Taylor). Surprisingly, this film was a box office sleeper. Based on the novel by Tom Perrotta.

results.title: The Hitcher
results.creator_credit: Robert Harmon, David Bombyk, Kip Ohman and Silver Screen Partners
results.brief_description: This dark, violent suspense thriller centres around the strange psychological bond between a travelling serial killer and one of his intended victims. Travelling from Chicago to California, Jim Halsey narrowly escapes an accident when he falls asleep at the wheel. To help stay awake, he picks up hitchhiker, John Ryder, but soon discovers his error when Ryder threatens his life. Although Jim manages to escape, he is soon led on a game of cat-and-mouse across the Texas highways, where Ryder leaves a trail of corpses for Jim to discover. Cast includes Rutger Hauer, C. Thomas Howell, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Jeffrey de Munn.

results.title: Best in show
results.creator_credit: Christopher Guest, Karen Murphy and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: Director Christopher Guest and cast members from his previous film ‘Waiting for Guffman’ reunite in this mockumentary following the exploits of five dogs and their handlers before the Mayflower Kennel Club Dog Show. Guest himself plays Harlan Pepper, a fly-fishing store owner and amateur ventriloquist, who decides to enter his beloved bloodhound Hubert in the prestigious competition. His competition includes “Winky”, a Norwich terrier, owned by neurotic couple Gerry and Cookie Fleck (Eugene Levy and Catherine O’Hara) and “Beatrice” a high-strung Wiemaraner owned by preppy couple Meg and Hamilton Swan (Parker Posey and Michael Hitchcock). Also making the trip to Philadelphia are Scott (John Michael Higgins) and Stefan (Michael McKean), life-partners from New York and their beloved Shih Tzu “Miss Agnes”, and trophy wife Sheri Ann Cabot (Jennifer Coolidge) and her friend and dog trainer, Christy Cummings (Jane Lynch) and their poodle, two time ‘Mayflower Best in Show’ winner, “Rhapsody in White”, also known as Butch. Cast also includes Fred Willard, Bob Balaban, Ed Begley Jr and Lewis Arquette.

results.title: Stella does tricks
results.creator_credit: Coky Giedroyc, Adam Barker, British Film Institute, Channel Four Television, Compulsive Films and Sidewalk Productions
results.brief_description: Having escaped Glasgow and the sexual abuse of the father she once adored, Stella winds up on the streets of London as a teenage prostitute with a vicious middle-aged pimp. Despite her bleak and seemingly hopeless circumstances, a streak of anger and yearning drives her to escape the sadistic men who dominate her life, but not before her pimp exacts one last act of savage abuse. The film shifts abruptly between Stella’s romanticised interior world of memories and fantasies, and the real world where her rage erupts into acts of vandalism and often poetic revenge on the men who have mistreated her. Giedroyc draws on her former experience as a director of realist drama and documentary for British television, handling the often confronting subject matter frankly and suffusing the film with a sense of outrage and urgency. Cast includes Kelly Macdonald, James Bolam, Hans Matheson and Ewan Stewart.

results.title: Nelly and Mr Arnaud = Nelly & Monsieur Arnaud [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Claude Sautet, Alain Sarde, Cecchi Gori Group Tiger Cinamatografica, Les Films Alain Sarde and TF1 Films productions
results.brief_description: Nelly (Emmanuel Beart) is a woman unhappily married to Jerome (Charles Berling), an unemployed and unmotivated man whose attitude towards her borders on contempt. Nelly is struggling with their financial situation, juggling several odd jobs to make ends meet. One day she meets by chance at a restaurant, Mr Arnaud. He is an elderly, retired judge, reasonably well off and estranged from his wife and children. Arnaud, a complete stranger, offers to pay her debts, no strings attached, and Nelly reluctantly agrees. Intrigued by Nelly, Arnaud employs her to help him record his memoirs. Nelly is depicted as a somewhat aloof woman searching for a connection to those around her. Mr Arnaud is a man near the end of his life, financially secure but dwelling on past regrets, both personal and professional. The bond between them intensifies and as Nelly embarks on an affair with a dashing young publisher, Vincent (Jean-Hugues Anglade), Nelly and Arnoud’s relationship is threatened. Created from an original script, “Nelly and Mr Arnaud” is a gently observed tale about friendship and the vagaries of the heart. This was the last film directed by Claude Sautet before his death. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Knowledge of healing
results.creator_credit: Franz Reichle, Marcel Hoehn and T&C Film AG
results.brief_description: The Knowledge of Healing is the first feature length documentary dealing with Tibetan medicine. Originally recorded in Gyushi, “The Knowledge of Healing” is a medical manual written in the 12th century. Its text describes one of the most highly developed, holistic approaches to medicine, comprising its own pharmacopoeia of herbs, roots and minerals. The film explains the text through case studies of patients progressing under treatment for ailments and conditions deemed incurable in the West. The film also contains interviews with two leading Tibetan physicians as well as H.H. The Dalai Lama. In Tibetan, Russian, German and Buryat with English subtitles.
